sentences.en: But such displays of defiance belie a widening sense of despair among Mr Ahmadinejad's opponents.
sentences.cn: 然而,这些反弹声浪掩饰不了艾马丹加对手日与俱增的绝望感.

sentences.en: Emilia . Thou dost belie her, and thou art a devil.
sentences.cn: 爱米利娅你冤枉她, 你是个魔鬼.

sentences.en: He spoke roughly in order to belie his air of gentility ( James Joyce )
sentences.cn: 为了给人有贵族气派的印象,他说话粗暴( 詹姆斯乔伊丝 )

sentences.en: Her energy and youthful good looks belie her 65 years.
sentences.cn: 她的活力与年轻美貌使人看不出她有65岁了。

sentences.en: Her pleasant manner belied her true character.
sentences.cn: 她讨人喜欢的举止掩饰了她真实的个性。

sentences.en: His cheerful appearance belie his feelings.
sentences.cn: 他欢愉的外表掩饰了他不安的情绪.

sentences.en: His cheerful smile belied his words.
sentences.cn: 他那开心的笑容证明他的话是假的。
他的衣服掩饰了他的身分.
他的外表掩饰[使人误会]他的品格.

sentences.en: Lily's incisive lyrical observations belie her years.
sentences.cn: 莉莉尖锐的歌词掩饰她真实的年龄.

sentences.en: Should I do so, I should belie my thoughts.
sentences.cn: 假如我真的如此做的话, 会和我的想法不符的.

sentences.en: Such convoluted steps belie the underlying strength of what is being sold.
sentences.cn: 这些复杂的措施辱没了将被出售公司的内在实力.

sentences.en: The acts of enemy belie their words of seeking peace.
sentences.cn: 敌人的行动与他们追求和平的言词不一.

sentences.en: The gentle lower slopes belie the true nature of the mountain.
sentences.cn: 低缓的山坡掩盖了这座山的真实特点.

sentences.en: Trends in other commodities also belie a broader slowdown.
sentences.cn: 其它初级商品的趋势也与更广泛减速的现象不符.

trans.tran_en: to give someone a false idea about something

trans.tran_cn: 歪曲真相，掩饰，证明…为虚假，辜负，使…失望，与…不符
trans.tran_en: to show that something cannot be true or real
